title: WindowsApps Mozilla Profile folder location? Where are you?
content:
winget install -e --id Mozilla.Firefox

I am a Windows 11 home 64bit Korean version user. Insider. Version 10.0.22621.105 Firefox latest version. I installed it like this. winget install -e --id Mozilla.Firefox

my installed path. C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\Mozilla.MozillaFirefox_101.0.1.0_x64__(random number letters)\VFS\ProgramFiles\MozillaFirefox Package Root (Where my app runs.)

C:\Users\user\AppData\Roaming\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles\1234.default-release My symptoms.. there is nothing in that location. Error. So I created a temporary folder. I'm looking for the user profile folder.


Organize my writing. The add-on is working. However. The profile folder is empty. I wonder where it is.
creator: krdondon

title: Broken Dowloads
content: Hi, I was downloading a few videos last night and the last one seemed to get stuck. Completely done, .part was gone but would not finish. I could not pause it either. Left in the downloads as "unknown time left". Downloading it again finished with no problem but was left with a file I could not delete. I tried downloading a couple other things and they too got stuck. I used an addon download manager that removed them from Firefox's download progress but could not delete them. I tried using cmd to delete them and had no luck being able to delete them that way. So I am stuck with 1 at "unknown time", 1 file at .98 gb, 2 files with 0 bytes and 3 .part that I cannot remove.
creator: rodneymullencmc

title: SEC_ERROR_UNKNOWN_CRITICAL_EXTENSION
content:
I am getting the error SEC_ERROR_UNKNOWN_CRITICAL_EXTENSION on every page i open. I have looked around and tried to fix it using similar error messages but nothing has worked. I have uninstalled and reinstalled but nothing has worked.

Can anyone help me as there is nothing online that i can find that will fix this.
creator: colbarron

title: removing autofill items
content:
I entered my password accidentally into the username field on a webmail page. It keeps showing several entries I made in the past every time I log in. How do I get rid of these entries? I searched the subject and all the suggestions of deleting it in the dropdown box with SHIFT+DELETE or CTRL+DELETE don't work.

I also use Vivaldi browser and I have the same issue when logging in to webmail. The list of usernames is different from Firefox so I know the lists are tied to the particular browser. I was able to delete the entire list with Vivaldi and I logged in to webmail and auto-fill list is gone. Can't do the same in Firefox. Please help.
creator: hongtoh.trevor

title: Is the preferred abbreviation for Firefox still "Fx"?
content:
In the early days of Firefox, the FAQs in the release notes mentioned that the preferred abbreviation is "Fx":

> How do I capitalize Firefox? How do I abbreviate it? > Only the first letter is capitalized (so it's Firefox, not FireFox.) The preferred abbreviation is "Fx" or "fx".

However, some time ago (unsure when exactly), this question was dropped off the FAQs. In fact, I can't find any mentions of a preferred abbreviation in any recent documentation.

Does this mean that the Mozilla Foundation no longer has a preferred abbreviation for Firefox? If "Fx" is still preferred (or not), does anyone have a link to an official documentation or statement from the Foundation indicating this?
creator: dextersgenius
